intro: Lophiaris chrysops, commonly known as the golden spurge, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is known for its ability to store water in its leaves, which helps it survive in drought conditions. The plant's striking appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
